entry.title: STATE PENITENTIARY REPORTS DOUGLAS COUNTY MAN IN-CUSTODY DEATH
entry.summary: March 10,2025 3:50 a.m. The Oregon Department of Corrections has reported that an adult in custody, 63-year-old Shannon Wade Spencer died on the evening of March 7th. Spencer was incarcerated at Oregon State Penitentiary in Salem and passed away at a local hospital. He entered DOC custody on February 12th, 2019, from Douglas County with...

entry.title: ROSEBURG CITY COUNCIL WITH VARIED AGENDA MONDAY NIGHT
entry.summary: March 10, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Roseburg City Council has a varied agenda for its meeting Monday night. Councilors will vote on authorizing the city manager to sign the twenty-first extension of the Inmate Housing Intergovernmental Agreement with Douglas County. This would extend the current agreement to June 30th, 2026, and reflects a 4 percent...

entry.title: GOODS FROM THE WOODS FORESTRY TOUR MARCH 21ST
entry.summary: March 10, 2025 3:20 a.m. The Oregon State University Extension Forestry and Natural Resources program and local partners will hold a walking tour, called “Goods from the Woods” on March 21st. The event will take place at the Glide Educational Forest from 10:00 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. It is a celebration of the International Day...

entry.title: SCHOLARSHIP NIGHT, FUTURE FIRST CITIZEN AWARD
entry.summary: March 10, 2025 3:05 a.m. The Roseburg High School Foundation will have its scholarship night featuring the Future First Citizen Award on Wednesday night at 5:30 p.m. in the RHS Student Center. Foundation President Brian Prawitz said the award recognizes five top seniors as future leaders, volunteers, supporters and role models who will make a...

entry.title: OREGON STATE PARKS TO HIRE MORE THAN 200 SEASONAL RANGERS
entry.summary: March 10, 2025 2:50 a.m. Oregon State Parks will hire more than 200 seasonal rangers and ranger assistants for positions across the state in the 2025 season. A release from the Oregon Parks and Recreation Department said hiring starts as soon as this month and runs through June with new positions listed on a rolling...

entry.title: GLENDALE WOMAN DIES IN VEHICLE VERSUS PEDESTRIAN CRASH NORTHWEST OF MEDFORD
entry.summary: March 9, 2025 6:50 a.m. A Glendale woman died in a vehicle versus pedestrian crash northwest of Medford on Friday morning. A report from Oregon State Police said a preliminary investigation indicated just after 6:00 a.m. a pickup, operated by a Medford man, was traveling eastbound on Highway 140 near Blackwell Road when it struck...

entry.title: GLIDE MAN JAILED ON MULTIPLE METHAMPHETAMINE CHARGES
entry.summary: March 8, 2025 1:00 p.m. A Glide man was jailed on multiple methamphetamine charges on Friday. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said at 2:00 p.m., 65-year-old Duane Willamson was stopped for a traffic violation near the intersection of Highway 138E and Abbott Street in Glide. Williamson was detained for failure to carry and present....

Undersheriff Brad O’Dell of the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office said Thursday evening at 8:20 p.m. dispatchers received a missing person report from the family of 18-year-old Danielle Clinesmith. O’Dell said Clinesmith...

entry.title: WASHINGTON MAN JAILED FOLLOWING PURSUIT INCIDENT
entry.summary: March 7, 2025 11:00 a.m. A Washington State man was jailed following a pursuit incident on Thursday night. A Douglas County Sheriff’s Office report said just after 10:30 p.m. a mini-van passed a deputy on Interstate Five southbound near the Scotts Valley/Elkhead exit going 92 miles-per-hour in a 65-mile-per hour zone. entry.title: TRANSIENT JAILED FOR SECOND-DEGREE CRIMINAL TRESPASS
entry.summary: March 7, 2025 10:30 a.m. A transient was jailed on a charge of second-degree criminal trespass on Thursday afternoon. entry.title: Forestry expert discusses density management in Winchester
entry.summary: WINCHESTER — The Healthy Forest Advisory Committee and Umpqua Community College’s Forestry Club partnered to bring James Johnston to Winchester to present his extensive research on how density management can improve stand health.
